data.title: Choose the correct answer for each question

sections.explain: Correct usage of the word 'to' in a sentence.

words.word: I am going to the store.
I am going too the store.
I am going two the store.

sections.explain: Correct usage of the word 'too' in a sentence.

words.word: She was too tired to continue.
She was to tired to continue.
She was two tired to continue.

sections.explain: Correct usage of the word 'two' in a sentence.

words.word: He has two cats at home.
He has too cats at home.
He has to cats at home.

sections.explain: Correct usage of the word 'be' in a sentence.

words.word: I want to be a teacher.
I want to bee a teacher.
I want to b a teacher.

sections.explain: Correct usage of the word 'bee' in a sentence.

words.word: The bee landed on the flower.
The be landed on the flower.
The b landed on the flower.

sections.explain: Correct usage of the word 'b' in a sentence.

words.word: The letter B comes after A.
The letter bee comes after A.
The letter be comes after A.

sections.explain: Correct usage of the word 'eye' in a sentence.

words.word: I saw a dog in the park.
Eye saw a dog in the park.
Aye saw a dog in the park.

sections.explain: Correct usage of the word 'I' in a sentence.

words.word: She hurt her eye playing football.
She hurt her I playing football.
She hurt her aye playing football.

sections.explain: Correct usage of the word 'aye' in a sentence.

words.word: The sailor shouted aye to agree.
The sailor shouted eye to agree.
The sailor shouted I to agree.
